meanings.definition: A person who solicits business, employment, support, or patronage aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The touter outside the store was trying to attract customers with his loud voice.
meanings.sent2: The touter handed out flyers to promote the new restaurant in town.
meanings.sent3: The touter at the fair wore a funny hat to grab people's attention.
meanings.sent4: She was like a touter in the jungle, calling out to animals to come closer.
meanings.sent5: The touter's persistent nature made him successful in sales.

meanings.definition: To solicit, peddle, or persuade importunately.
meanings.sent1: He would touter his products to anyone passing by on the street.
meanings.sent2: The street vendor toutered his wares to the tourists visiting the city.
meanings.sent3: She would touter her friends to join her for a movie night.
meanings.sent4: The politician toutered his promises to the voters during the campaign.
meanings.sent5: The salesman toutered his pitch with enthusiasm to close the deal.
